title: [$250] Prevent redundant API call when re-selecting the same role on member details page

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.41-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @cead22 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1761865677014229) ## Action Performed: Precondition: Workspace with members 1. Navigate to workspace settings 2. Open the member details page for any user 3. Locate the role selector (e.g., Member, Admin) 4. Select the same role the user currently has 5. Observe that an API call is still triggered despite no change occurring ## Expected Result: No API call should be made if the selected role is the same as the existing one. ## Actual Result: An API call to update the user’s role is triggered even though the value has not changed. ##Proposed Solution: Implement a validation check before making the update call, similar to the approach used in [updateGeneralSettings](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/src/libs/actions/Policy/Policy.ts#L1540-L1541), which verifies that the new value differs from the existing one before posting the update. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
## Screenshots/Videos
Add any screenshot/video evidence

title: [$250] “Expense over category daily limit” violation missing in NewDot but visible in OldDot

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.41-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @iwiznia **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1761862095103959) ## Action Performed: Precondition: Enable rules in workspace settings and set flag amounts over for a category (Meals and Entertainment) 1. Create an expense and allow it to SmartScan 2. Select the category (Meals and Entertainment) 3. SmartScan detects an amount lower than the actual total 4. Manually edit the amount to a higher value 5. Observe the violations displayed on the report in NewDot 6. Open the same report in OldDot (expensify.com) ## Expected Result: Both violations — “Amount greater than scanned receipt” “Expense over category daily limit” — should display in NewDot just as they do in OldDot. ## Actual Result: Only “amount greater than scanned receipt” violation appears in NewDot. The “Expense over category daily limit” violation is missing from the expense and report view, though it appears correctly in OldDot. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.41-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1594/folder/13176707/41236898/983218028 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck103025@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome, iPhone 16/iOS 18.3.1 **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Precondition: 1. User is a admin of a control workspace that has enabled rules, tags & approvals in workflows 2. Admin has invited few members to WS 3. Admin has added tags Steps: 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Navigate to workspace settings >> Tags 3. Select the added tag 4. Select approver field in tag rules 5. Select any user 6. Observe selected user is not reflected in Approver field 7. Select the approver field again & observe green checkmark displayed 8. Click back button twice 9. Select tag & observe the selected approver is now displayed 10. Unselect the user & observe user not removed below approver field ## Expected Result: On step 6 & 10 - Selected user should correctly reflected below Approver field when select & unselect users ## Actual Result: On step 6 & 10 - Selected user not reflected below Approver field when select & unselect users. Blank field is first displayed on selecting approver. Approver shown correctly only after user navigated back to tags page & revisit tag rules ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57ef5eec-e757-4029-9df6-40a8b45a9260 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: External

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted

labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.41-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdniosjsdonsj@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two expenses. 4. Click Submit and Approve. 5. Create another expense. 6. Click Submit. 7. Go to Reports > Reports. 8. Expand both report rows. 9. Select one of the expenses from approved report (from Step 4) and select the unapproved expense (from Step 6). 10. Click dropdown button. ## Expected Result: Dropdown menu will not show Approve button because one of the selected expenses is already approved. ## Actual Result: Dropdown menu still shows Approve button when one of the selected expenses is already approved. This issue does not happen if user selects all expenses from both reports. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b32e451e-2f17-4d10-8244-3ef9fb21027c [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
